JobTitle: Senior Manager, Platform, and Partner Communications
JobFullDesc:
Slack is a messaging app for business which lets you organize conversations into channels so everyone moves faster and stays in sync. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Our mission is to make people’s working lives simpler, more pleasant and more productive. 
The Senior Communications Manager, Platform and Partner, is critical to the success of our growing team. You will build and execute integrated communications campaigns in support of our business objectives. You will help reporters, influencers, and other priority audiences understand why Slack is transformative. You are an expert PR practitioner who instinctively understands what makes a good story, but also has a passion for integrated communications, influencer and marketing campaigns that drive results.
You will be responsible for generating broad awareness of the Slack Developer Platform (think: apps, integrations, and workflows) and accompanying partnership initiatives that are growth drivers for the business. Telling these stories in earned, owned and paid opportunities, as well as across our social platforms, will attract new customers to Slack, and help existing customers accelerate the value they derive from the platform.
As a key contributor to the global comms team at Slack, you will join our mission to articulate how to use this period of enormous change - a massive positive shift in the way people work - for good. Through earned, owned and paid programs, you will help guide people and organizations through the transformation required to thrive in the new era of work.
Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture—we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like a good fit for you, why not say hello?
What you will be doing

Drive evangelism of Slack’s narrative, with a focus on, but not limited to, the Slack Developer Platform and our partnership initiatives
Partner closely with product and corporate communications with an “all hands on deck” mentality when big launches and events are at hand
Partner closely with our Social team in developing content and thought leadership to support our social programs
Independently develop comms strategies and lead execution of key programs and campaigns, leveraging internal resources and managing your agency team
Manage proactive and reactive Security and Reliability communications, including for our Bug Bounty program 
Manage proactive and reactive communications for the Slack Fund, Slack’s VC arm that’s invested in notable startups like Hopin, Notion, and MURAL
Media relations: Platform and product news, thought leadership, proactive user education storytelling
Partner closely with Product Marketing, Social, AR, Events, Brand, Product & Engineering, Legal and others on cross functional initiatives
Support Slack’s executive and subject matter expert content program, collaborating closely with key company executives
Partner and align closely with international counterparts

What you should have

Strong media relations skills and a passion for PR (10-12 years experience) 
Agency and In-house enterprise software/technology communications preferred
Developer or security communications experience is preferred
Experience working closely with executives up to and including c-level  
Hunger for an exciting opportunity; ready to roll up your sleeves and dig in!
Passionate about Slack and about learning about how work is evolving
Creative, thoughtful and passionate about storytelling
Exceptional writing skills
Highly organized, detail-oriented and able to meet deadlines consistently
Skilled at managing up, prioritizing and setting expectations as needed
Open and effective communicator; someone who is not afraid to throw out an idea or challenge an existing one to help advance Slack’s mission   
Curious; eager to learn and open to trying new things
A self-starter, able to initiate and run with projects
Collaborative and able to work cross-functionally
Critical thinker; strong executive presence; ability to hold a “seat at the table” alongside other areas of the business
Flexible: able to juggle multiple responsibilities at once and unphased by change whenever it happens (“cool as a cucumber”, as they say)

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work.
Come do the best work of your life here at Slack!
